metadata.title: CVE-2016-7142 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The m_sasl module in InspIRCd before 2.0.23, when used with a service thatsupports SASL_EXTERNAL authentication, allows remote attackers to spoofcertificate fingerprints and consequently log in as another user via acrafted SASL message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

inspircd - 2.0.23-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: inspircd package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.23-1').
